subject: Productivity
title: Cloud Computing and Collaboration
description: A quick, practical guide to Cloud Computing and Collaboration.

hook.text: Google Docs let ten people edit the same document simultaneously. No more emailing version 12 final final.

buildup.text: Cloud computing moved files from hard drives to servers. Access anywhere became the new normal.

discovery.text: Real-time collaboration eliminated version conflicts and reduced coordination overhead dramatically.

twist.text: But shared documents created new problems: too many editors, constant changes, and notification overload.

climax.text: The cloud proved that tools shape teamwork. Better tools don't just help ‚Äî they change how people work.

punchline.text: The cloud killed version conflicts. It created new ones.

quiz.question: What major problem did real-time collaboration tools solve?
options: Version conflicts from emailing files back and forth
